abstract.p: Dr John S Sundy letter on June 1 article calls for consortium of major purchasers of health care to fund research into medical quality assurance and process improvement

block.p: Re ''Health Insurance Provides Buffer to Rising Drug Prices for Most Americans'' (news article, June 1): Ford Motor Company's $470 million prescription drug cost is staggering. More disconcerting is not knowing how well this money is being spent.

It is time for a consortium of major purchasers of health care to invest in the same kind of research into medical quality assurance and process improvement that has improved the profitability of companies like Ford.

Re ''Health Insurance Provides Buffer to Rising Drug Prices for Most Americans'' (news article, June 1): Ford Motor Company's $470 million prescription drug cost is staggering. More disconcerting is not knowing how well this money is being spent.

It is time for a consortium of major purchasers of health care to invest in the same kind of research into medical quality assurance and process improvement that has improved the profitability of companies like Ford.

This research could be conducted independently in diverse practice settings, under the oversight of the nation's academic medical centers. While this arrangement raises potential conflict-of-interest issues, the knowledge gained would benefit patients and doctors.
JOHN S. SUNDY, M.D. Durham, N.C., June 1, 2000
The writer is an instructor at Duke University Medical Center.
